p: The reduced cancer rates associated with the Mediterranean diet and the history of Olea europaea products in traditional medicine have made olive tree products the focus of phytochemical research [ 34â€“ 36]. Studies have identified some compounds from olive tree products for a deeper investigation of their cytotoxic effect. The most ubiquitous compounds are the phenolic compounds, flavonoids, secoiridoids and secoiridoid glycosides. However, compounds such as flavanones, flavone glycosides, triterpenes, benzoic acid derivatives, biophenols, sterols, sugars, xylitol and isochromans have clear biological activities [ 28].
